description.narrative: TI Cambodia’s vision is for all Cambodians to live in a society that is free from corruption. TICs programme has four Components with their own set of expected results including impact, outcomes, output and activties: 1. Public Sector engagement and coalition building programme Expected Programme’s Impact: Enhanced public service delivery at national and sub-national levels and increasing accountability and transparency of fiscal governance. Outcomes: 1. Enhanced public service delivery at national and sub-national levels 2. Increased public understanding and demand for fiscal transparency and accountability 3. Strengthened effectiveness of alternative reporting mechanisms on corruption cases through the Advocacyand Legal Advice Centre (ALAC) and enhanced the anti-corruption legal and regulatory frameworks Citizen and youth empowerment programme Expected Programme’s Impact: Increased public demands for anti-corruption and enhanced civic participation by allcitizens in decisions that affect their lives Outcomes 1. Increased women, youth and citizens understanding and knowledge of good governance, integrity,transparency and corruption and its effects on their lives and society 2. Enhanced participation by youths on anti-corruption and increased demands for positive reforms Business Integrity Programme Expected Programme’s Impact: Increased accountability, integrity and transparency in business practices Outcomes 1. Policies adopted for a more level playing field through increased advocacy from business associations andgovernment dialogue. 2. Responsible Business Conduct (RBC) principles, including business integrity, adopted and implemented byCambodian businesses. 3. Increased research and advocacy on relevant private sector issues, including RBC and business integrityleading to raised awareness amongst the broader private sector of these topics. 4. The Business Integrity Consultancy continues to operate and provide services for the private sector, CSOs,and DPs. 5. Enhanced transparency and accountability in the award of mining sector permits, licence and contracts Governance foundation and capacity development Expected Programme’s Impact: Enhanced capacity of TIC’s staff and increased its members and their commitmentin the fight against corruption. Outcomes 1. Enhanced governance structure and capacity of TIC to effectively manage and deliver results onanti-corruption at both national and sub-national levels. 2. Increased members for TIC and increased their commitment among citizens/youth/institutionsto promote integrity and take actions against corruption. 1. Enhanced knowledge and understanding of corruption, accountability, transparency and its effects through evidence-based research and studies. Research and advocacy programme Expected Programme’s Impact: Well-informed anti-corruption stakeholders and publics on the state of governance,sector-based studies on corruption issues that affect the lives of people/business community, and addressed emergingcorruption cases or abuse of power. Outcome 1. Enhanced knowledge and understanding of corruption, accountability, transparency and its effectsthrough evidence-based research and studies.

Transparency International Cambodia har ansökt om finansiering från Sida för att genomföra "Transparency International Cambodia, Strategic Plan 2020-2022, Collective Action Against Corruption (CA2C)” i Kambodja under perioden 2020-2022. Insatsen syftar till att uppnå ett samhälle fritt från korruption samt bidra till PAT-programmets övergripande mål ”Stärkt efterfrågan på och tillgång till transparens och ansvarsutkrävande i den offentliga sektorn genom institutionell kapacitetsutveckling”. Huvudsyftet med TIC: s strategiska plan är att stärka efterfrågan, deltagandet och kapaciteten hos viktiga målgrupper i Kambodja för att bekämpa korruption. Bland de aktörer som kommer att kunna bidra till att minska, förebygga och minska korruption återfinns civilsamhällets organisationer, ungdomsgrupper, medborgare, institutioner i den offentliga sektorn och företagare.
Insatsen har följande delmål:
1. Förbättrade offentliga tjänster på nationell och lokal nivå och ett ökad ansvarstagande och öppenhet i skatteförvaltningen 2. Ökade offentliga krav på minskad korruption och ökad möjlighet till folkligt deltagande i beslut som påverkar deras situation. 3. Ökad ansvarsskyldighet, integritet och öppenhet inom privatsektor. 4. Förbättrad kapacitet hos TIC's personal och en ökad medlemsbas med ett ökat engagemang i kampen mot korruption. 5. Partners är välinformerade om korruptionsfrågor och hur de påverkar människor och näringslivet har kapacitet att bemöta nya fall av korruption och maktmissbruk.
Insatsens totala budget är SEK 25 500 000.

Transparency International Cambodia has applied to Sida for funding to carry out the "Transparency International Cambodia, Strategic Plan 2020-2022, Collective Action Against Corruption (CA2C)" in Cambodia during the period 2020-2022. The main objective of TIC strategic plan is to strengthen demand, participation and capacity of key stakeholders in Cambodia to fight corruption. Stakeholders that will be able to contribute to reduce, prevent and reduce corruption include youth groups, civil society organisations, citizens, public sector institutions and businesses.
The intervention aims to achieve a society that is free from corruption and contributing to the overall goal established for the PAT programme “Strengthened demand for and supply of public transparency and accountability through institutional capacity development”, by focusing on the following subobjectives :
1. Enhanced public service delivery at national and sub-national levels and increasing accountability and transparency of fiscal governance. 2. Increased public demands for anti-corruption and enhanced civic participation by all citizens in decisions that affect their lives 3. Increased accountability, integrity and transparency in business practices Governance foundation and capacity development 4. Enhanced capacity of TIC’s staff and increased its membership base and their commitment in the fight against corruption. 5. Well-informed anti-corruption stakeholders and publics on the state of governance, sector-based studies on corruption issues that affect the lives of people/business community, and addressed emerging corruption cases or abuse of power.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK 25 500 000.

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

description.narrative: 2020 is the first year of the second phase of the Partnership for Accountability and Transparency (PAT) programme which of is partly financed by Sida and partly by the EU. The most recent report submitted in February 2020 covers implementation of the revious agreement phase and is therefore assessed in the Completion Report of the former contribution. The first report from the new agreement phase will be submitted in February 2021.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
